text:
Beautiful private art gallery space that is great for hosting events in a very private setting that will surprise you and your guests!

The owner and staff has been very friendly and would definitely come back again to visit!

A few days ago, I visited 39+ Art Space with friends, and I must say, it’s probably one of the nicest small-to-medium-sized galleries I’ve ever been to! The artworks on display are meticulously curated, a testament to the excellent work of the curatorial team. I’m still debating whether to buy one of the horse drawings above the lobby desk—if only I wasn’t broke, haha!

It’s such a great place to visit and get lost in the art. A big shoutout to Ning at the lobby, who was incredibly kind and helpful for educating and facilitating us!
Large spacious gallery now hosting dual shows - My Universe by India’s Kalpana Shah and Concept of Parallel Events II by Chinese artist Liang Manqi.

The curation was spot-on, with each area having a cohesive and vibrant vibe that really drew me in. However, the experience was dampened by staff, who was unwelcoming from the moment I arrived. Their unfriendly demeanor made it hard to fully enjoy the art. It's a shame that such beautiful works are overshadowed by poor customer service.
Jacopo Pagin: Strategies Against Time (4 Jan 2023 - 26 Feb 2023)
